question.text: While analyzing the DNA of an organism, it was found that adenine proportion was 30%. What would be the proportion of cytosine in its DNA?

solution.text: DNA is the nucleic acid that forms the genetic material in all organisms. The structure of deoxyribose nucleic acid was elucidated by Watson and Crick. The DNA is a double helical structure having two anti-parallel strands of polynucleotide chains joined to each other by hydrogen bonding formed between the N-bases. In a double stranded DNA, the ratios between Adenine and Thymine and Guanine and Cytosine are constant and equals one; this observation was given by Erwin Chargaff. Thus,  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">G</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>&</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>;</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">G</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> . Therefore, percentage of Adenine and Thymine are same and that of Guanine and Cytosine is same.  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">G</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">%</mi><mo>;</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">%</mi></math> .
